result.execSummary:
Adam M Volenberg was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Adam M Volenberg was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam M Volenberg

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Adam M Volenberg
Current: 4540 Winnequah Rd, Madison, WI 53716 United States  (Effective: 03-04-2016)
Prior: 720 Mayfair Ave, Madison, WI 53714
Copy of 2/18/16 Order & JFFO mailed to Defendant returned w/COA. (Fwd to updated address on 3/4/16)
Order for payment of attorney fees

For Payment of Attorney Fees - It is hereby ordered that the Defendant is liable for court appointed attorney fees.  The attorney fees shall be assessed to case 15CF302 and converted to Civil Judgment.
with attachments and proposed order for payment of court appointed defense counsel fees from Attorney David Zarwell in the amount of $785.20.Petition is for 15CF302 & 15CF304

Case called at 1:44pm [mo]
Defendant Adam M Volenberg in court, in custody with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Zarwell indicates that Mr. Volenberg intends to waive the extradiction; presents 3 signed Waiver of Extradiction forms to the Court.
The Court informs Mr. Volenberg his extradiction rights.
Mr. Volenberg indicates that he understands his extradiction rights and he is waiving them.
The Court accepts the waiver made by Mr. Volenberg and endorses the Waiver of Extradiction forms. 
The Court and Counsel discuss pendency of Mr. Volenberg's Wisconsin case. 
recess: 1:49pm
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
not endorsed by the Court - Counsel appointed on the record
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.

Cases 15CF302 and 15CF304 called at 1:25pm [mo]
Defendant Adam M Volenberg in court, in custody.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court confirms with Mr. Volenberg that the Public Defender's office conducted an assessment and found Mr. Volenberg ineligible for SPD representation.
Mr. Volenberg indicates that he wishes to Petition the Court for court appointed counsel; submits petition. 
The Court appoints Attorney David Zarwell to Mr. Volenberg's cases. The Court will address re-payment of attorney fees at a later time.
Cases 15CF302 and 15CF304 are to be re-called at 3:00pm today.
recess: 1:31pm--reconvene: 3:28pm

Defendant Adam M Volenberg in court, in custody with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CF302:
Both parties waive time limits
Atty. Zarwell requests a PTC and STC
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.

As to Case 15CF304(Extradiction hearing scheduled):
Atty. Zarwell requests a return date prior to the 30 day time limits
--no objection from ADA Hall 

recess: 3:35pm

NEXT: 
As to Case 15CF304: (1)Extradiction Hearing on 10/15/15 at 1:30pm (will be held in Branch 2, Judge Koschnick will preside)
As to Case 15CF302: (1)Pretrial Conference on 11/4/15 at 11:20am (2) Status Conference on 11/19/15 at 2:00pm
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Appeared for Bail Purposes Only
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Cases 15CF302 and 15CF304 called together at 1:50-pm. [mo]
Defendant Adam M Volenberg appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann (For Bond Purposes Only).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint  appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Hagemann indicates that it is uncertain at this time if Mr. Volenberg is eligible for PD representation
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Court verifies date of birth and address on Criminal Complaint
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in case 15CF302

On Case 15CF302:
The Court requires a $30,500  CASH bond, with conditions:
--remain in Jefferson County
--remain in the State of Wisconsin
--surrender passport to Jefferson County Clerk of Courts, if possess
--surrender international travel Identification  card to Jefferson County Clerk of Courts, if possess
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription
--take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no acts or threats of violence

As Case 15CF304:
Atty. Hagemann confirms that Mr. Volenberg is the person mentioned in the warrants
The Court finds that Mr. Adam M. Volenberg is the same person charged with crimes in attached warrants
The Court finds that the Def. has fled from justice and has failed to appear in the State of Illinois.
The Court orders that Mr. Volenberg be held in the Jefferson Co. Jail not longer that 30 days.
The Court recites statute 976.03
The Court holds Mr. Volenberg without bail

The Court gives Mr. Volenberg his right to counsel; Mr. Volenberg indicates that he does wish to be represented by counsel
The Court on its own motion extends time limits of Preliminary Hearing
--no objection from Counsel
recess 2:25pm. 


NEXT: On Case 15CF304: Extradiction Hearing on 10/13/15 at 1:15pm
           On Case 15CF302: Adjourned Initial Appearance on 10/2/15 at 9:30am
